result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas A Ruiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs/surcharges. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Comply with all other conditions in Count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas A Ruiz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas A Ruiz in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CF142, 15TR761, 15TR762 & 15TR1145.

11:41 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.
Amended Information filed. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF142:
Count 1 (amended) - Guilty 
Count 2 - Guilty

15TR761:
Count 1 - Dismissed

15TR762:
Count 1 - Dismissed 

15TR1145:
Count 1 - Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 & 2 of 15CF142 and 15TR761 Dismissed, 15TR762 Dismissed and 15TR1145 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CF142:
Count 1 (amended) -
Impose/Stay Sentence 120 day jail sentence
18 months probation
25 hours community service 
Pay costs/surcharges
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Maintain full-time employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Count 2 -
Impose/Stay Sentence 30 day jail sentence to run concurrent to Count 1
18 months probation concurrent to Count 1
Pay costs/surcharges
Comply with all other conditions in Count 1

15TR761:
Count 1 - Dismissed

15TR762:
Count 1 - DRI

15TR1145:
Count 1 -
Pay Forfeiture totalling $761.50
Pay blood draw $26.45
DL revocation 6 months   Revocation is retroactive to the date of the administrative suspension from the Dept. of Transportation
Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Nicholas A Ruiz in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. ADA Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.
Pretrial is today.
Bond Continued.

Arraignment at 08-31-2015 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference at 08-31-2015 09:30 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas A Ruiz in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits waived.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas A Ruiz in court. Indigency hearing, no one needs to appear for the State of Wisconsin.

10:51 AM Court calls case.
Defendant states his name.

Defendant dropped off petition to the Branch 2 office.
Time is taken to retreive petition.

10:58 AM Court now has the petition.

10:59 AM Nicholas Ruiz is called and sworn in.
Examination by the Court.

BY THE COURT:
Court will appoint an attorney at county's expense.

Defendant is advised to wait a moment to find out who the attorney will be.
Defendant is advised he still needs to appear for initial appearance this afternoon.

2:37 p.m. Defendant Nicholas A Ruiz in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant states he not eligible for public defendar and will make appointment with Br 2.
Bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia.  Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

Defendant Nicholas A Ruiz in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant can contact Public Defender for Representation
Court orders defendant to see Public Defender today. 
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
